metadata.title: CVE-2015-8869 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
OCaml before 4.03.0 does not properly handle sign extensions, which allowsremote attackers to conduct buffer overflow attacks or obtain sensitiveinformation as demonstrated by a long string to the String.copy function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8869` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

camlp4 - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3.1
camlp4-extra - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3.1
ocaml - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3.1
ocaml-base - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3.1
ocaml-base-nox - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3.1
ocaml-compiler-libs - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3.1
ocaml-interp - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3.1
ocaml-mode - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3.1
ocaml-native-compilers - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3.1
ocaml-nox - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3.1
ocaml-source - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ocaml package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.01.0-3ubuntu3.1').
